questions.questionText: A can complete a work in 10 days. What part of work can A complete in 1 day?
A can do work in 12 days, B in 15 days. How long will they take working together?
A does a work in 20 days, B does same work in 30 days. In how many days will they complete it together?
If A can complete work in 6 days and B in 8 days, what fraction of work do they complete in 1 day together?
A is twice as efficient as B. If B takes 15 days to complete a work, how many days will A take?
questions.explanation: A is twice as efficient, so A takes half the time = 15/2 = 7.5 days

questions.questionText: A can do a piece of work in 10 days and B in 15 days. They worked together for 4 days, then A left. In how many more days will B finish the remaining work?
questions.explanation: Work done in 4 days = 4×(1/10 + 1/15) = 4×5/30 = 2/3. Remaining = 1/3. B takes (1/3)/(1/15) = 5 days

questions.questionText: A, B and C can do a work in 10, 12 and 15 days respectively. How long will they take together?
questions.explanation: Combined work per day = 1/10 + 1/12 + 1/15 = (6+5+4)/60 = 15/60 = 1/4. Time = 4 days

questions.questionText: A can complete work in 8 days. B is 50% more efficient than A. How many days will B take?
questions.explanation: B is 1.5 times efficient, so takes 8/1.5 = 5.33 days

questions.questionText: A works 3 times as fast as B. If B completes a work in 24 days, how many days will both take together?
A and B together complete a work in 12 days. If A alone takes 20 days, how many days will B alone take?
